DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to study the relation between mechanical ventilation and ADMA concentrations at birth.
DOC.brief_title: ADMA and Mechanical Ventilation in Preterm Infants
DOC.detailed_description: Nitric oxide (NO) plays an important role in the normal development and maturation of the lungs. In addition, NO is an important mediator of vascular smooth muscle relaxation, ventilation perfusion matching, neurotransmission and host defence and bacteriostasis. Asymmetric dimethylarginine (ADMA) is an endogenous derivative of arginine that inhibits NOS and thereby the bioavailability of NO. Preterm infants have increased concentrations of ADMA. Therefore, inhibition of NO by increased concentrations of ADMA which could be associated with reduced pulmonary functioning.
DOC.criteria: Gestational age < 32 weeks Birth weight < 1500 gram Written informed consent of parents Congenital abnormalities Chromosomal abnormalities
